data.title: Death of man who cracked Hitler’s code
data.meta_description: Raymond “Jerry” Roberts, the last remaining codebreaker from a Bletchley Park team that deciphered Hitler’s messages, has died at the age of 93.Captain Roberts, from Liphook in Hampshire, was one of
data.text:
Raymond “Jerry” Roberts, the last remaining codebreaker from a Bletchley Park team that deciphered Hitler’s messages, has died at the age of 93.

Captain Roberts, from Liphook in Hampshire, was one of four analysts who founded a unit at the cryptology facility in Buckinghamshire, which was dedicated to cracking the intricate ciphers of the Second World War.

A linguist fluent in German, Captain Roberts was given the task of penetrating “Lorenz”, a system far more complex than the Enigma machine, with four times as many encryption wheels. Lorenz was used by the German High Command and occasionally by Hitler, and baffled the Allies for the first two years of the war.
